channel.title: Upper left hand corner
channel.description:
Is there ANY way to change what it says in the upper left hand corner of the screen when you scroll over...Say...Something in the quest log, skills menu, etc? ...Is it possible? Because when I scroll over the quests I'm making...I don't want it to say in the corner "black knights' fortress"...I also want it to light up when I scroll over it...
Picture:
[IMG]http://i553.photobucket.com/albums/jj374/AD_Setsuna/lefthandcorner.jpg[/img]
Wanted to change what it says in teh corner when I scroll over..."Tutorial" (Which was Black Knights' Fortress) etc...
I would also like them to highlight, as seen in the picture below... [IMG]http://i553.photobucket.com/albums/jj374/AD_Setsuna/questproblem1.jpg[/img]

item.title: Upper left hand corner
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Well, I meant in general. And okay…Tell me if you find anything on it. =[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 17, 2009, 08:00:01 pm[/size][hr]Sigh…Where would I experiment…? Class9 or client?..[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 17, 2009, 08:05:47 pm[/size][hr] if(class9.anInt262 == 5) { String s = class30_sub2_sub2.method415(); if(class44_1 != null && s.length() > 0) { int i4 = s.lastIndexOf(","); class9.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = method207(Integer.parseInt(s.substring(i4 + 1)), false, class44_1, s.substring(0, i4)); } s = class30_sub2_sub2.method415(); if(class44_1 != null && s.length() > 0) { int j4 = s.lastIndexOf(","); class9.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = method207(Integer.parseInt(s.substring(j4 + 1)), false, class44_1, s.substring(0, j4)); } }

NO clue what that means or anything, but I searched for i4 in class9…That came up.

Read full topic

item.title: Upper left hand corner
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

That stuff is unrelated to the quest list.
That’s for displaying text for other options in the upper-left corner of the client, such as the log out button and emotes.

Read full topic

item.title: Upper left hand corner
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

if(class9.aString221.length() == 0) { if(class9.anInt217 == 1) { class9.aString221 = "Ok"; } if(class9.anInt217 == 4) { class9.aString221 = "Select"; } if(class9.anInt217 == 5) { class9.aString221 = "Select"; } if(class9.anInt217 == 6) { class9.aString221 = "Continue"; } } }

Well, I thought something like that would have something to do with it…Am I wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Upper left hand corner
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

This is the code that displays the text (aString248) found in method105:

                        if(class9_1.aBoolean223)
                            class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method382(i4, k2 + class9_1.anInt220 / 2, anInt939, s1, l6, class9_1.aBoolean268);
                        else
                            class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method389(false, class9_1.aBoolean268, k2, i4, s1, l6);

From experimenting with it I’ve found out that i4 is the color. So it has to do with how that variable is changed before it displays the text.
So the reason it isn’t being highlighted when you hover over it is somewhere in that method.
I’ll tell you if I have an idea of what the problem might be. Good luck.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Thanks! That worked, but I still cannot seem to get them to light up when you scroll over them…I’ll post a pic of what I mean in my first post…

EDIT: Updated the first post, added that picture in.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 16, 2009, 08:29:51 pm[/size][hr]And…The help goes away again. =p[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 16, 2009, 09:15:52 pm[/size][hr] if(class9.aString221.length() == 0) { if(class9.anInt217 == 1) { class9.aString221 = "Ok"; } if(class9.anInt217 == 4) { class9.aString221 = "Select"; } if(class9.anInt217 == 5) { class9.aString221 = "Select"; } if(class9.anInt217 == 6) { class9.aString221 = "Continue"; } } }

Something like that, I’m guessing? Dunno what to change for what I need, though…

item.title: Upper left hand corner
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Under

class9.aString221 = class30_sub2_sub2.method415();

in Class9.java add

if(class9.aString221.equals("Black Knight's Fortress"))
    class9.aString221 = "Tutorial";

If you have some sort of cache editing tool you can probably use that instead.

If you’re planning on doing it for more than one String, try this:

/**
 * Add the text you want to replace in the first array, and the text to replace it with in the second.
 */
private static String[][] replace = {
{ "Black Knights' Fortress", "Wanted!" }, { "Tutorial", "Example" }
};
for(int i2 = 0; i2 < replace[0].length; i2++)
{
    class9.aString221 = class9.aString221.replaceAll(replace[0][i2], replace[1][i2]);
}

I know, it’s hardcoding. But it’s the best solution I can think of.

Read full topic
